title: gd ligature
content:
Hi everyone.

I am helping a friend out with a magazine logo tweak and wondered if anyone could advise on the best way to construct a gd ligature with Adobe Caslon.

Does anyone know of this being done before, regardless of the typeface?

Thanks,

Graham

 [‹ 50's lifestyle magazine font redesign](http://web.archive.org/web/20080709010600/http:/www.typophile.com/node/40184 "Go to previous forum topic") [Modern Sans Serif Suggestion ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080709010600/http:/www.typophile.com/node/40051 "Go to next forum topic")
author: G T

comments.content: With a little work it wouldn’t be too had to find a good way to bring the ear over to the bowl of d.
You might get quite an amusing bespectabled form :)
Maybe you could merge the top bowl of the g and the bowl of the d. You’d have to figure out how to elegantly reconcile their sizes, positions, and stresses, though.

here’s what I’ve done so far.

Something just bugs me about it.
